suppress.notes: Dependency of spring-ws-security, which is already at latest version (3.0.10.RELEASE).
Not relevant for us as we do not use velocity templates.
Workaround for Spring WS Security misidentification: https://github.com/jeremylong/DependencyCheck/issues/3811
Workaround for misidentification: sarif4k is not the same as detekt, even though it comes from the detekt developer(s)
Spring Security 5.4+ are not vulnerable to this, but the OSSINDEX database incorrectly flags at least 5.7.1 vulnerable

In Apache Tomcat 10.1.0-M1 to 10.1.0-M16, 10.0.0-M1 to 10.0.22, 9.0.30 to 9.0.64 and 8.5.50 to 8.5.81 the Form authentication example in the examples web application displayed user provided data without filtering, exposing a XSS vulnerability

Suppressed as this does not affect evaka
Versions of the Amazon AWS Apache Log4j hotpatch package before log4j-cve-2021-44228-hotpatch-1.3.5 are affected by a race condition that could lead to a local privilege escalation
